fall.states package

Submodules

fall.states.base module

Base state class

class fall.states.base.State(classifier: Classifier, representation_constructor: Callable[[int], ConceptRepresentation], state_id: int = -1, train_representation: bool = True)

Bases: object

A base state containing a Classifier and ConceptRepresentation

__init__(classifier: Classifier, representation_constructor: Callable[[int], ConceptRepresentation], state_id: int = -1, train_representation: bool = True) → None
add_active_state_relevance(active_state_relevance: float) → None

Update statistics tracking active_state_relevance. Should only be called when an observation is deemed stable.

deactivate_train_representation() → None

Deactivate training representation. Some representations are not trained, e.g., implied error rate.

get_current_relevance() → float
get_in_concept_relevance() → float
get_self_representation() → ConceptRepresentation

Get the concept representation using this states classifier, on data drawn from this concept.

learn_one(supervised_observation: Observation, force_train_classifier: bool = False) → State

Train the classifier and concept representation. concept_id determines the concept the observation is thought to be drawn from. The state classifier is NOT trained on observations with a concept_id which does not match the state_id unless force_train_classifier is set, however other statistics are updated.

supervised_observation: Observation

The observation to train on. Must be supervised, i.e., have a valid y value. The prediction on the observation is not used, but a new one is added to ensure that the most up to date predictions are used.

force_train_classifier: bool

Default: False Forces the state classifier to train on an observation regardless of which concept_id the observation is from. When false, only observations with with an active_state_id matching the state_id are used to train the classifier.

predict_one(unsupervised_observation: Observation, force_train_own_representation: bool = False) → Union[bool, str, int]

Make a prediction using the state classifier. Also trains unsupervised components of the classifier and concept representation.

unsupervised_observation: Observation

An unsupervised observation, may have a None y. Predictions for the state_id will be added to observation.predictions.

force_train_own_representation: Bool

Default: False Forces the state to train the concept_representation representing data with the current state_id. If false, we train the representation representing the active_state_id associated with the observation.

step(sample_weight: float = 1.0, is_active: bool = True) → None

Step states tracking statistics

fall.states.test_states module

fall.states.test_states.test_classifier_equivalence() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying state.

fall.states.test_states.test_classifier_inactive() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying state. Since the state is not active, the classifier should not train.

fall.states.test_states.test_classifier_inactive_force() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying state. Since the state is not active, but training is forced, the classifier should train.

fall.states.test_states.test_representation_equivalence() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying concept_representaion.

fall.states.test_states.test_representation_equivalence_inactive() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state when it is unactive. should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying concept_representaion.

fall.states.test_states.test_representation_equivalence_inactive_forced() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state when it is unactive. should be equivalent to calling directly on the underlying concept_representaion.

fall.states.test_states.test_representation_notrain() → None

Calling predict_one and learn_one on a state should not update the representation if disabled.

Module contents

Handles states, where a state is a (Classifier, ConceptRepresentation) pair
